get.description:
Return a list of participants from live or past meetings. 

 If you don't provide the `type` query parameter, the default value is set to the `live` value. This API only returns metrics for participants in a live meeting, if any exist. You can specify a monthly date range for the dashboard data using the `from` and `to` query parameters. The month should fall within the last six months. 

**Note:** 

This API may return empty values for participants' `user_name`, `ip_address`, `location`, and `email` responses when the account calling this API: 
* Is a [**legacy** HIPAA BAA account](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/references/legacy-business-associate-agreements/). 
* Displays data for any users who are **not** part of the host's account (external users) unless they meet certain conditions. See [Email address display rules](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/using-zoom-apis/#email-address-display-rules) for details. 

**Prerequisites:** 
* A Business or higher plan.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `dashboard_meetings:read:admin`,`dashboard:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `dashboard:read:list_meeting_participants:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `HEAVY`

parameters.name: meetingId
parameters.description:
The meeting's ID or universally unique ID (UUID). 
* If you provide a meeting ID, the API returns a response for the latest meeting instance. 
* If you provide a meeting UUID that begins with a `/` character or contains the `//` characters, you **must** double-encode the meeting UUID before making an API request.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
The type of meeting to query. 
* `past` - All past meetings. 
* `pastOne` - All past one-user meetings. 
* `live` - All live meetings. 

This value defaults to `live`.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of records returned within a single API call.

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: Use the next page token to paginate through a large set of results. A next page token returns whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. The expiration period for this token is 15 minutes.

parameters.name: include_fields
parameters.description:
This field provides `registrant_id` as the value for this field if you would like to see the registrant ID attribute in the response of this API call. 

A registrant ID is a unique identifier of a [meeting registrant](/docs/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/meetingRegistrants), which is not supported for `live` meeting types.

200.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `200`  
 
Meeting participants returned.  
 
This API is only available for ZMP and Business or higher accounts that have enabled the Dashboard feature.

next_page_token.description: Use the next page token to paginate through a large set of results. A next page token returns whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. The expiration period for this token is 15 minutes.

page_count.description: The number of pages returned for the request made.

page_size.description: The number of records returned within a single API call.

total_records.description: The number of all records available across pages.

meeting_number.description: Unique identifier of the meeting in "long" format(represented as int64 data type in JSON)

participants.description: The information about the meeting participants. If a participant left a meeting and rejoined the same meeting, their information appears as many times as they joined the meeting.

audio_quality.description:
The participant's [audio quality score](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360061244651-Using-meeting-quality-scores-and-network-alerts). The API only returns this value when the **Meeting quality scores and network alerts on Dashboard** setting is enabled in the Zoom Web Portal and the **Show meeting quality score and network alerts on Dashboard** option is selected in [**Account Settings**](https://zoom.us/account/setting). 
* `good` - The audio is almost flawless and the quality is excellent. 
* `fair` - The audio occasionally has distortion, noise, and other problems, but the content is basically continuous. Participants can communicate normally. 
* `poor` - The audio often has distortion, noise, and other problems, but the content is basically continuous. Participants can communicate normally. 
* `bad` - The sound quality is extremely poor and the audio content is almost inaudible.

camera.description:
The type of camera that the participant used during the meeting. 

**Note:** This response returns an empty string (``) value for any users who are **not** a part of the host's account (external users).

as_connection_type.description: The participant's screen share connection type.

customer_key.description: The participant's SDK identifier. This value can be alphanumeric, up to a maximum length of 35 characters.

data_center.description: The data center that the participant is leveraging to join the meeting.

device.description:
The type of device the participant used to join the meeting. 
* `Phone` - The participant joined via PSTN. 
* `H.323/SIP` - The participant joined via an H.323 or SIP device. 
* `Windows` - The participant joined via VoIP using a Windows device. 
* `Mac` - The participant joined via VoIP using a Mac device. 
* `iOS` - The participant joined via VoIP using an iOS device. 
* `Android` - The participant joined via VoIP using an Android device. 

**Note:** This response returns an empty string (``) value for any users who are **not** a part of the host's account (external users).

domain.description:
The participant's PC domain. 

**Note** This response returns an empty string (``) value for any users who are **not** a part of the host's account (external users).

email.description: The participant's email address. If the participant is **not** part of the host's account, this returns an empty string value, with some exceptions. See [Email address display rules](/docs/api-reference/using-zoom-apis#email-address) for details.

from_sip_uri.description: The meeting participant's SIP From header URI. The API only returns this response when the participant joins a meeting via SIP.

full_data_center.description: The data center where participant's meeting data is stored. This field includes a semicolon-separated list of HTTP Tunnel (HT), Cloud Room Connector (CRC), and Real-Time Web Gateway (RWG) location information.

harddisk_id.description:
The participant's hard disk ID. 

**Note** This response returns an empty string (``) value for any users who are **not** a part of the host's account (external users).

id.description:
The participant's universally unique ID (UUID).
* If the participant joins the meeting by logging into Zoom, this value is the `id` value in the [**Get a user**](/docs/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/user) API response. 
* If the participant joins the meeting **without** logging into Zoom, this returns an empty string value. 

**Note:** Use the `participant_user_id` value instead of this value. We will remove this response in a future release.

in_room_participants.description: The number of participants that joined via Zoom Room.

internal_ip_addresses.description:
The participant's internal IP addresses. This field will not return under these specific conditions. 
* The account calling this API is a **legacy** [business associate agreement (BAA) under HIPAA](https://www.ecfr.gov/cgi-bin/retrieveECFR?gp=1&n=se45.1.160_1103&r=SECTION&ty=HTML). 
* The account calling this API is a BAA under HIPAA **without** a signed BAA data processing addendum.

join_time.description: The time when a participant joined the meeting.

leave_reason.description:
The reason why the participant left the meeting, where `$name` is the participant's username: 
* `$name left the meeting.` 
* `$name got disconnected from the meeting.` 
* `Host ended the meeting.` 
* `Host closed the meeting.` 
* `Host started a new meeting.` 
* `Network connection error.` 
* `Host did not join.` 
* `Exceeded free meeting minutes limit.` 
* `Removed by host.` 
* `Unknown reason.` 
* `Leave waiting room.` 
* `Removed by host from waiting room.`
enum: Removed by host from waiting room.

leave_time.description: The time when a participant left the meeting. For live meetings, this field only returns if a participant has left the ongoing meeting.

mac_addr.description:
The participant's MAC address. 

**Note** This response returns an empty string (``) value for any users who are **not** a part of the host's account (external users).

microphone.description:
The type of microphone that the participant used during the meeting. 

**Note:** This response returns an empty string (``) value for any users who are **not** a part of the host's account (external users).

network_type.description:
The participant's network type. 

* `Wired` 
* `Wifi` 
* `PPP` - Point-to-Point. 
* `Cellular` - 3G, 4G, and 5G cellular. 
* `Others` - An unknown device.

participant_user_id.description:
The participant's universally unique ID (UUID). 
* If the participant joins the meeting by logging into Zoom, this value is the `id` value in the [**Get a user**](/docs/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/user) API response. 
* If the participant joins the meeting **without** logging into Zoom, this returns an empty string value.

recording.description: Whether the recording feature was used during the meeting.

registrant_id.description:
The participant's unique registrant ID. This field only returns if you pass the `registrant_id` value for the `include_fields` query parameter. 

This field does not return if the `type` query parameter is the `live` value.

screen_share_quality.description:
The participant's [screen share quality score](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360061244651-Using-meeting-quality-scores-and-network-alerts). The API only returns this value when the **Meeting quality scores and network alerts on Dashboard** setting is enabled in the Zoom Web Portal and the **Show meeting quality score and network alerts on Dashboard** option is selected in [**Account Settings**](https://zoom.us/account/setting). 
* `good` - The video is almost flawless and the quality is excellent. 
* `fair` - The video definition is high, occasionally gets stuck, fast or slow, or other problems, but the frequency is very low and the video quality is good. 
* `poor` - The video definition is not high, but not many problems exist. The video quality is mediocre. 
* `bad` - The picture is very blurred and often gets stuck.

share_application.description: Whether the participant chose to share an iPhone or iPad app during the screenshare.

share_desktop.description: Whether the participant chose to share their desktop during the screenshare.

share_whiteboard.description: Whether the participant chose to share their whiteboard during the screenshare.

sip_uri.description: The meeting participant's SIP (Session Initiation Protocol) Contact header URI. The API only returns this response when the participant joins a meeting via SIP.

speaker.description:
The type of speaker that the participant used during the meeting. 

**Note:** This response returns an empty string (``) value for any users who are **not** a part of the host's account (external users).

status.description:
The participant's status. 
* `in_meeting` - In a meeting. 
* `in_waiting_room` - In a waiting room.

user_id.description: The participant's ID. This value assigned to a participant upon joining a meeting and is only valid for the meeting's duration.

participant_uuid.description: The participant's UUID. This value assigned to a participant upon joining a meeting and is only valid for the meeting's duration.

video_quality.description:
The participant's video quality. The API only returns this value when the **Meeting quality scores and network alerts on Dashboard** setting is enabled in the Zoom Web Portal and the **Show meeting quality score and network alerts on Dashboard** option is selected in [**Account Settings**](https://zoom.us/account/setting). 
* `good` - The video is almost flawless and the quality is excellent. 
* `fair` - The video definition is high, occasionally gets stuck, fast or slow, or other problems, but the frequency is very low and the video quality is good. 
* `poor` - The video definition is not high, but not many problems exist. The video quality is mediocre. 
* `bad` - The picture is very blurred and often gets stuck.

bo_mtg_id.description: The [breakout room](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/206476313-Managing-breakout-rooms) ID. Each breakout room is assigned a unique ID.

audio_call.description: Information about the meeting participant's audio call. Some participants may join the meeting through the phone call or are bound to the audio.

has_archiving.description: The status of the archiving feature for the meeting.

optional_archiving.description: This is shown only for internal participants who have archiving enabled.

client.description: Client software version or SDK version.

total_jointime_cost.description: The participant join meeting time cost, in seconds.

aic_disclaimer.description: The participant's AI Companion disclaimer status.

**HTTP Status Code:** `404`

get.description:
Show a list of meeting participants from live or past meetings, and their quality of service received during the meeting. The data returned indicates the connection quality for sending or receiving video, audio, and shared content. 

**Note:** 

This API may return empty values for participants' `user_name`, `ip_address`, `location`, and `email` responses when the account calling this API. 
* Does **not** have a signed HIPAA business associate agreement (BAA). 
* Is a [**legacy** HIPAA BAA account](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/other-references/legacy-business-associate-agreements/). 
* Displays data for any users who are **not** part of the host's account (external users) unless they meet certain conditions. See [Email address display rules](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/using-zoom-apis/#email-address-display-rules) for details. 

**Prerequisites:** 
* A Business or a higher plan.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `dashboard_meetings:read:admin`,`dashboard:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `dashboard:read:list_meeting_participants_qos:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `HEAVY`

participant_uuid.description: The participant's UUID. This value assigned to a participant upon joining a meeting and is only valid for the meeting's duration.

network_type.description: The participant's network type. * `Wired` * `Wifi` * `PPP` - Point-to-Point. * `Cellular` - 3G, 4G, and 5G cellular. * `Others` - An unknown device.

data_center.description: The data center that the participant is leveraging to join the meeting.

full_data_center.description: The data center where participant's meeting data is stored. This field includes a semicolon-separated list of HTTP Tunnel (HT), Cloud Room Connector (CRC), and Real-Time Web Gateway (RWG) location information.

share_application.description: Whether the participant chose to share an application during the meeting.

share_desktop.description: Whether the participant chose to share their desktop during the screenshare.

share_whiteboard.description: Whether the participant chose to share their whiteboard during the screenshare.

recording.description: Whether the recording feature was used during the meeting.

has_archiving.description: The status of the archiving feature for the meeting

optional_archiving.description: Client software version or SDK version

total_jointime_cost.description: The participant join meeting time cost, the unit is seconds.

email.description: The participant's email address. If the participant is **not** part of the host's account, this returns an empty string value, with some exceptions. See [Email address display rules](/docs/api-reference/using-zoom-apis#email-address) for details.

items.description: Information about the participant and their quality of service (QoS).

Can not access a meeting a year ago.

404.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `404`

The meeting ID is not valid or the meeting has not ended yet.

Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

get.description:
When a meeting ends, each attendee will be prompted to share their meeting experience by clicking either thumbs up or thumbs down. Use this API to retrieve the feedback submitted for a specific meeting. Note that this API only works for meetings scheduled after December 20, 2020.

**Prerequisites:**
* [Feedback to Zoom](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115005838023) setting must be enabled by the participant prior to the meeting.
* The user making the API request must be enrolled in a Business or a higher plan.

  
  

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `dashboard_meetings:read:admin`,`dashboard:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `dashboard:read:post_meeting_feedback:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `Heavy`

parameters.name: meetingId
parameters.description:
The meeting's ID or universally unique ID (UUID). 
* If you provide a meeting ID, the API will return a response for the latest meeting instance. 
* If you provide a meeting UUID that begins with a `/` character or contains the `//` characters, you **must** [double encode](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/using-zoom-apis/#meeting-id-and-uuid) the meeting UUID before making an API request.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
Specify a value to get the response for the corresponding meeting type. The value of this field can be one of the following:  
    
 `past` - Meeting that already occurred in the specified date range.  
 `pastOne` - Past meetings that were attended by only one user.   
 `live` - Live meetings.  
   
 

If you do not provide this field, the default value will be `live` and thus, the API will only query responses for live meetings.

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: Use the next page token to paginate through large result sets. A next page token is returned whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. This token's expiration period is 15 minutes.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of records returned within a single API call.

200.description: **HTTP Status Code:** `200`

next_page_token.description: The next page token is used to paginate through large result sets. A next page token will be returned whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. The expiration period for this token is 15 minutes.

page_size.description: The number of records returned within a single API call.

date_time.description: Date and time at which the feedback was submitted.

email.description: Email address of the participant. If the participant is **not** part of the host's account, this returns an empty string value, with some exceptions. See [Email address display rules](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/using-zoom-apis#email-address) for details.

quality.description:
Feedback submitted by the participant. 

* `GOOD`: Thumbs up.
* `NOT GOOD`: Thumbs down.

comment.description: Post meeting comment of the participant.

**HTTP Status Code:** `400`

get.description:
Retrieve the sharing and recording details of participants from live or past meetings.  
 
**Prerequisites:**   
 
* Business or a higher plan.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `dashboard_meetings:read:admin`,`dashboard:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `dashboard:read:meeting_sharing:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `Heavy`

parameters.name: meetingId
parameters.description:
The meeting's ID or universally unique ID (UUID). 
* If you provide a meeting ID, the API will return a response for the latest meeting instance. 
* If you provide a meeting UUID that begins with a `/` character or contains the `//` characters, you **must** [double encode](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/using-zoom-apis/#meeting-id-and-uuid) the meeting UUID before making an API request.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
The type of meeting to query: 
* `past` — All past meetings. 
* `live` - All live meetings. 

This value defaults to `live`.

parameters.description: The number of records returned within a single API call.

page_size.description: The number of records returned within a single API call.

total_records.description: The number of all records available across pages.

details.description: Array of sharing and recording details.

id.description: Universally unique identifier of the Participant. It is the same as the User ID of the participant if the participant joins the meeting by logging into Zoom. If the participant joins the meeting without logging in, the value of this field will be blank.

user_id.description: Participant ID. This is a unique ID assigned to the participant joining a meeting and is valid for that meeting only.

get.description:
Return the quality of service (QoS) report for participants from live or past meetings. The data returned indicates the connection quality for sending/receiving video, audio, and shared content. The API returns this data for either the API request or when the API request was last received. 

When the sender sends data, a timestamp is attached to the sender's data packet. The receiver then returns this timestamp to the sender. This helps determine the upstream and downstream latency, which includes the application processing time. The latency data returned is the five second average and five second maximum. 

 This API will **not** return data if there is no data being sent or received at the time of request. 

**Note:** 

This API may return empty values for participants' `user_name`, `ip_address`, `location`, and `email` responses when the account calling this API: 
* Does **not** have a signed HIPAA business associate agreement (BAA). 
* Is a [**legacy** HIPAA BAA account](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/other-references/legacy-business-associate-agreements/). 
* Displays data for any users who are **not** part of the host's account (external users) unless they meet certain conditions. See [Email address display rules](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/using-zoom-apis/#email-address-display-rules) for details. 



**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `dashboard_meetings:read:admin`,`dashboard:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `dashboard:read:meeting_participant_qos:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `HEAVY`

parameters.name: meetingId
parameters.description:
The meeting's ID or universally unique ID (UUID). 
* If you provide a meeting ID, the API will return a response for the latest meeting instance. 
* If you provide a meeting UUID that begins with a `/` character or contains the `//` characters, you **must** double-encode the meeting UUID before making an API request.

parameters.name: participantId
parameters.description: The participant's ID.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
The type of meeting to query. 
* `past` - All past meetings. 
* `live` - All live meetings. 

This value defaults to `live`.

200.description: **HTTP Status Code:** `200`   Meeting participant QOS returned. This API is only available for ZMP and Business or higher accounts that have enabled the Dashboard feature.

schema.title: Participant QOS

id.description: The participant's universally unique ID. This value is the same as the participant's user ID if the participant joins the webinar by logging into Zoom. If the participant joins the webinar without logging into Zoom, this returns an empty value.

device.description:
The type of device the participant used to join the meeting. 
* `Phone` - The participant joined via PSTN. 
* `H.323/SIP` - The participant joined via an H.323 or SIP device. 
* `Windows` - The participant joined via VoIP using a Windows device. 
* `Mac` - The participant joined via VoIP using a Mac device. 
* `iOS` - The participant joined via VoIP using an iOS device. 
* `Android` - The participant joined via VoIP using an Android device. 

**Note:** This response returns an empty string (`““`) value for any users who are **not** a part of the host's account (external users).

domain.description:
The participant's PC domain. 

**Note:** This response returns an empty string (`““`) value for any users who are **not** a part of the host's account (external users).

harddisk_id.description:
The participant's hard disk ID. 

**Note:** This response returns an empty string (`““`) value for any users who are **not** a part of the host's account (external users).

internal_ip_addresses.description:
The participant's internal IP addresses. This field will not return under these conditions: 
* The account calling this API is a **legacy** [business associate agreement (BAA) under HIPAA](https://www.ecfr.gov/cgi-bin/retrieveECFR?gp=1&n=se45.1.160_1103&r=SECTION&ty=HTML). 
* The account calling this API is a BAA under HIPAA **without** a signed BAA data processing addendum.

join_time.description: The time when the participant joined the meeting.

leave_time.description: The time when the participant left the meeting.

mac_addr.description:
The participant's MAC address. 

**Note:** This response returns an empty string (`““`) value for any users who are **not** a part of the host's account (external users).

user_id.description: The participant's ID. This value is assigned to a participant upon joining a meeting and is only valid for the meeting's duration.

user_qos.description: The participant's quality of service information.

latency.description: The time it took a packet to travel from one point to another, in milliseconds.

max_loss.description: The maximum amount of packet loss, such as the maximum percentage of packets that failed to arrive at their destination.

frame_rate.description: The rate where the video camera can produce unique images (frames). Zoom supports a frame rate of up to 30 fps.

resolution.description: The number of pixels in each dimension that the video camera can display.

max_rssi.description: Maximum value of the wireless network's received signal strength indicator (RSSI).

avg_rssi.description: Average value of the wireless network's received signal strength indicator (RSSI).

min_rssi.description: Minimum value of the wireless network's received signal strength indicator (RSSI).

rssi_unit.description: Unit of the wireless network's received signal strength indicator (RSSI).

wifi_rssi.description: The QoS metrics for the wireless network's RSSI sent by a participant who joined the meeting through a wireless network.

as_connection_type.description: The participant's screen share connection type.

participant_uuid.description: The participant's UUID. This value assigned to a participant upon joining a meeting and is only valid for the meeting's duration.

network_type.description: The participant's network type. * `Wired` * `Wifi` * `PPP` - Point-to-Point. * `Cellular` - 3G, 4G, and 5G cellular. * `Others` - An unknown device.

microphone.description: The type of microphone that the participant used during the meeting. **Note:** This response returns an empty string (``) value for any users who are **not** a part of the host's account, such as external users.

speaker.description: The type of speaker that the participant used during the meeting. **Note:** This response returns an empty string (``) value for any users who are **not** a part of the host's account, such as external users.

camera.description: The type of camera that the participant used during the meeting. **Note:** This response returns an empty string (``) value for any users who are **not** a part of the host's account, such as external users.

data_center.description: The data center that the participant is leveraging to join the meeting.

full_data_center.description: The data center where participant's meeting data is stored. This field includes a semicolon-separated list of HTTP Tunnel (HT), Cloud Room Connector (CRC), and Real-Time Web Gateway (RWG) location information.

share_application.description: Whether the participant chose to share an application during the meeting.

share_desktop.description: Whether the participant chose to share their desktop during the screenshare.

share_whiteboard.description: Whether the participant chose to share their whiteboard during the screenshare.

recording.description: Whether the recording feature was used during the meeting.

has_archiving.description: The status of the archiving feature for the meeting.

optional_archiving.description: This is shown only for internal participants who have archiving enabled.

total_jointime_cost.description: The participant join meeting time cost, the unit is seconds.

meeting_number.description: Unique identifier of the meeting in "long" format(represented as int64 data type in JSON)

email.description: The participant's email address. If the participant is **not** part of the host's account, this returns an empty string value, with some exceptions. See [Email address display rules](/docs/api-reference/using-zoom-apis#email-address) for details.

schema.description: Information about the participant and their quality of service (QoS).

get.description:
Use this API to return [meeting quality score](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360061244651-Meeting-quality-scores-and-network-alerts-on-Dashboard) information. Meeting quality scores are based on the mean opinion score (MOS). The MOS measures a meeting's quality on a scale of "Good" (5-4), "Fair" (4-3), "Poor" (3-2), or "Bad" (2-1). 

**Prerequisites:** 
* A Business or a higher plan.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `dashboard_home:read:admin`,`dashboard:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `dashboard:read:meeting_quality_score:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `Heavy`

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Start date in 'yyyy-mm-dd' format. The date range defined by the "from" and "to" parameters should only be one month as the report includes only one month worth of data at once.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: End date.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
The type of meeting quality score to query: 
* `meeting` — Query by meetings. 
* `participants` — Query by meeting participants.

200.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `200`  
 
Meeting quality returned

from.description: The report's start date. This value must be within the past six months.

bad.description: The total number of "Bad" quality scores.

fair.description: The total number of "Fair" quality scores.

good.description: The total number of "Good" quality scores.

poor.description: The total number of "Poor" quality scores.

bad.description: The total number of "Bad" quality scores.

fair.description: The total number of "Fair" quality scores.

good.description: The total number of "Good" quality scores.

poor.description: The total number of "Poor" quality scores.

bad.description: The total number of "Bad" quality scores.

fair.description: The total number of "Fair" quality scores.

good.description: The total number of "Good" quality scores.

poor.description: The total number of "Poor" quality scores.

quality.description: Information about the meeting quality scores.

to.description: The report's end date. This value must be within the past six months and cannot exceed a month from the `from` value.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

get.description:
Lists all the live or past webinars from a specified period of time.   
   
 
**Prerequisites**  
 
* Business, Education or API Plan with Webinar add-on.




**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `dashboard_webinars:read:admin`,`dashboard:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `dashboard:read:list_webinars:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `RESOURCE-INTENSIVE`

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
The type of webinar to query. 
* `past` - All past webinars. 
* `live` - All live webinars. 

This value defaults to `live`.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The start date in 'yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss' or 'yyyy-MM-dd'format. The date range defined by the `from` and `to` parameters should only be one month, as the report includes only one month's worth of data at once.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: The end date 'yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss' or 'yyyy-MM-dd' format.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of records returned within a single API call.

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: Use the next page token to paginate through large result sets. A next page token is returned whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. This token's expiration period is 15 minutes.

parameters.name: group_id
parameters.description:
The group ID. To get a group ID, use the [**List groups**](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/reference/scim-api/methods/#operation/groupSCIM2List) API.  Participants would be filtered according to their primary group. 

 **Note:** The API response will only contain webinars where the host is a member of the queried group ID if the "group_include_participant" is false. 
Allow to search multiple groups, when searching multiple items, separate them with commas.
The maximum size of groupids is 7

parameters.name: group_include_participant
parameters.description: Whether the response will contain webinars where the participant is a member of the queried group ID.

parameters.name: query_date_type
parameters.description:
The type of date to query. This field is only supported when `type` is `past`. 
* `start_time` - Query by call start time. 
* `end_time` - Query by call end time. 

This value defaults to `start_time`.

200.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `200`  
 
Meetings returned.  
 
Only available for paid accounts that have enabled the Dashboard feature.

from.description: The inputted 'from' parameter format, 'yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss' or 'yyyy-MM-dd' format.

to.description: The inputted 'to' parameter format, 'yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss' or 'yyyy-MM-dd' format.

next_page_token.description: Use the next page token to paginate through large result sets. A next page token is returned whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. This token's expiration period is 15 minutes.

page_count.description: The number of pages returned for the request made.

page_size.description: The number of records returned within a single API call.

total_records.description: The number of all records available across pages.

custom_keys.description: The custom keys and values assigned to the webinar.

key.description: The custom key associated with the webinar.

value.description: The value of the custom key associated with the webinar.

duration.description: The webinar duration, formatted as `hh:mm:ss`. For example, `10:00` for ten minutes.

email.description: The user email.

has_3rd_party_audio.description: Whether a third paty is being used for the webinar.

has_archiving.description: Whether the archiving feature was used in the webinar.

has_pstn.description: Whether or not PSTN was used for the webinar.

has_recording.description: Whether or not recording was used for the webinar.

has_screen_share.description: Whether or not screen sharing was used for the webinar.

has_sip.description: Whether or not SIP was used for the webinar.

has_video.description: Whether or not video was used for the webinar.

has_voip.description: Whether or not VoIP was used for the webinar.

has_manual_captions.description: Whether a manual caption was enabled in the meeting.

has_automated_captions.description: Whether an automated caption was enabled in the meeting.

id.description: The webinar ID in **long** format, represented as int64 data type in JSON. Also known as the webinar number.

audio_quality.description:
The webinar's [audio quality score](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360061244651-Using-meeting-quality-scores-and-network-alerts). 
* `good` - The audio is almost flawless and the quality is excellent. 
* `fair` - The audio occasionally has distortion, noise, and other problems, but the content is basically continuous. Participants can communicate normally. 
* `poor` - The audio often has distortion, noise, and other problems, but the content is basically continuous. Participants can communicate normally. 
* `bad` - The sound quality is extremely poor and the audio content is almost inaudible.

video_quality.description:
The webinar's [video quality score](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360061244651-Using-meeting-quality-scores-and-network-alerts). 
* `good` - The video is almost flawless and the quality is excellent. 
* `fair` - The video definition is high, occasionally gets stuck, fast or slow, or other problems, but the frequency is very low and the video quality is good. 
* `poor` - The video definition is not high, but not many problems exist. The video quality is mediocre. 
* `bad` - The picture is very blurred and often gets stuck.

screen_share_quality.description:
The webinar's [screen share quality score](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360061244651-Using-meeting-quality-scores-and-network-alerts). 
* `good` - The video is almost flawless and the quality is excellent. 
* `fair` - The video definition is high, occasionally gets stuck, fast or slow, or other problems, but the frequency is very low and the video quality is good. 
* `poor` - The video definition is not high, but not many problems exist. The video quality is mediocre. 
* `bad`- The picture is very blurred and often gets stuck.

has_poll.description: Whether or not poll was used in the meeting.

has_survey.description: Whether or not survey was used in the meeting.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

get.description:
Retrieve details from live or past webinars.  
   
 
**Prerequisites:**  
 
* Business, Education or API Plan with Webinar add-on.



**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `dashboard_webinars:read:admin`,`dashboard:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `dashboard:read:webinar:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `HEAVY`

parameters.name: webinarId
parameters.description:
The webinar's ID or universally unique ID (UUID). 
* If you provide a webinar ID, the API will return a response for the latest webinar instance. 
* If you provide a webinar UUID that begins with a `/` character or contains the `//` characters, you **must** [double encode](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/using-zoom-apis/#meeting-id-and-uuid) the webinar UUID before making an API request.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
The type of webinar to query: 
* `past` — All past webinars. 
* `live` - All live webinars. 

This value defaults to `live`.

200.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `200`  
 
Webinar details returned.  
 
Only available for paid accounts that have enabled the Dashboard feature.

custom_keys.description: Custom keys and values assigned to the Webinar.

key.description: Custom key associated with the Webinar.

value.description: Value of the custom key associated with the Webinar.

duration.description: Webinar duration, formatted as hh:mm:ss, for example: `10:00` for ten minutes.

email.description: User email.

has_archiving.description: Whether the archiving feature was used in the webinar.

has_pstn.description: Indicates whether or not PSTN was used for the Webinar.

has_recording.description: Indicates whether or not recording was used for the Webinar.

has_screen_share.description: Indicates whether or not screen sharing was used for the Webinar.

has_sip.description: Indicates whether or not SIP was used for the Webinar.

has_video.description: Indicates whether or not video was used for the Webinar.

has_voip.description: Indicates whether or not VoIP was used for the Webinar.

has_manual_captions.description: Indicates whether a manual caption was enabled in the meeting.

has_automated_captions.description: Indicates whether an automated caption was enabled in the meeting.

id.description: Webinar ID in "**long**" format(represented as int64 data type in JSON), also known as the webinar number.

audio_quality.description:
The webinar's [audio quality score](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360061244651-Using-meeting-quality-scores-and-network-alerts): 
* `good` — The audio is almost flawless and the quality is excellent. 
* `fair` — The audio occasionally has distortion, noise, and other problems, but the content is basically continuous. Participants can communicate normally. 
* `poor` — The audio often has distortion, noise, and other problems, but the content is basically continuous. Participants can communicate normally. 
* `bad` — The sound quality is extremely poor and the audio content is almost inaudible.

video_quality.description:
The webinar's [video quality score](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360061244651-Using-meeting-quality-scores-and-network-alerts): 
* `good` — The video is almost flawless and the quality is excellent. 
* `fair` — The video definition is high, occasionally gets stuck, fast or slow, or other problems, but the frequency is very low and the video quality is good. 
* `poor` — The video definition is not high, but not many problems exist. The video quality is mediocre. 
* `bad` — The picture is very blurred and often gets stuck.

screen_share_quality.description:
The webinar's [screen share quality score](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360061244651-Using-meeting-quality-scores-and-network-alerts): 
* `good` — The video is almost flawless and the quality is excellent. 
* `fair` — The video definition is high, occasionally gets stuck, fast or slow, or other problems, but the frequency is very low and the video quality is good. 
* `poor` — The video definition is not high, but not many problems exist. The video quality is mediocre. 
* `bad` — The picture is very blurred and often gets stuck.

has_poll.description: Whether or not poll was used in the meeting.

has_survey.description: Whether or not survey was used in the meeting.

**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request **Error Code:** `12702`

get.description:
Get information about participants from live or past webinars. 

**Note:** This API endpoint displays only information for external users (users **not** part of the host's account) that meet the criteria of the [email address display rules](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/using-zoom-apis/#email-address-display-rules), and returns empty values for participants who do not meet the criteria.  



**Prerequisites:** 
* A Business, Education, or API Plan with Webinar add-on.

* Any [**legacy** HIPAA BAA account](/docs/api-reference/other-references/legacy-business-associate-agreements). 
* No signed HIPAA business associate agreement (BAA).




**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `dashboard_webinars:read:admin`,`dashboard:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `dashboard:read:list_webinar_participants:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `HEAVY`

parameters.name: webinarId
parameters.description:
The webinar's ID or universally unique ID (UUID). 
* If you provide a webinar ID, the API returns a response for the latest webinar instance. 
* If you provide a webinar UUID that begins with a `/` character or contains the `//` characters, you **must** double-encode the webinar UUID before making an API request.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
The type of webinar to query. 
* `past` - All past webinars. 
* `live` - All live webinars. 

This value defaults to `live`.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of records returned within a single API call.

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: The next page token paginates through a large set of results. A next page token returns whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. The expiration period for this token is 15 minutes.

parameters.name: include_fields
parameters.description:
The additional fields to include in the query. 
* `registrant_id` - Includes the webinar registrant's ID. The registrant ID is the [webinar registrant's unique ID](/docs/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/webinarRegistrants).

200.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `200`  
 
Webinar participants returned.  
 
This API is only available for ZMP and Business or higher accounts that have enabled the Dashboard feature.

next_page_token.description: The next page token paginates through a large set of results. A next page token returns whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. The expiration period for this token is 15 minutes.

page_count.description: The number of pages returned for the request.

page_size.description: The number of records returned within a single API call.

total_records.description: The number of all records available across pages.

webinar_number.description: Unique identifier of the webinar in "long" format(represented as int64 data type in JSON).

audio_quality.description:
The participant's [audio quality score](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360061244651-Using-meeting-quality-scores-and-network-alerts). 
* `good` - The audio is almost flawless and the quality is excellent. 
* `fair` - The audio occasionally has distortion, noise, and other problems, but the content is basically continuous. Participants can communicate normally. 
* `poor` - The audio often has distortion, noise, and other problems, but the content is basically continuous. Participants can communicate normally. 
* `bad` - The sound quality is extremely poor and the audio content is almost inaudible.

as_connection_type.description: The participant's screen share connection type.

customer_key.description: The participant's SDK identifier. This value can be alphanumeric, up to a maximum length of 35 characters.

data_center.description: The data center that the participant is leveraging to join the webinar.

device.description:
The type of device the participant used to join the webinar. 
* `Phone` - The participant joined via PSTN. 
* `H.323/SIP` - The participant joined via an H.323 or SIP device. 
* `Windows` - The participant joined via VoIP using a Windows device. 
* `Mac` - The participant joined via VoIP using a Mac device. 
* `iOS` - The participant joined via VoIP using an iOS device. 
* `Android` - The participant joined via VoIP using an Android device. 

**Note:** This response returns an empty string (``) value for any users who are **not** a part of the host's account (external users).

domain.description:
The participant's PC domain. 

**Note:** This response returns an empty string (``) value for any users who are **not** a part of the host's account (external users).

email.description: The participant's email address. If the participant is **not** part of the host's account, this returns an empty string value, with some exceptions. See [Email address display rules](/docs/api-reference/using-zoom-apis#email-address) for details.

from_sip_uri.description: The meeting participant's SIP From header URI. The API only returns this response when the participant joins a meeting via SIP.

full_data_center.description: The data center where participant's meeting data is stored. This field includes a semicolon-separated list of HTTP Tunnel (HT), Cloud Room Connector (CRC), and Real-Time Web Gateway (RWG) location information.

harddisk_id.description:
The participant's hard disk ID. 

**Note:** This response returns an empty string (``) value for any users who are **not** a part of the host's account (external users).

id.description:
The participant's universally unique ID (UUID): 
* If the participant joins the meeting by logging into Zoom, this value is the `id` value in the [**Get a user**](/docs/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/user) API response. 
* If the participant joins the meeting **without** logging into Zoom, this returns an empty string value. 

**Note:** Use the `participant_user_id` value instead of this value. We will remove this response in a future release.

internal_ip_addresses.description:
The participant's internal IP addresses. This field will not return when: 
* The account calling this API is a **legacy** [business associate agreement (BAA) under HIPAA](https://www.ecfr.gov/cgi-bin/retrieveECFR?gp=1&n=se45.1.160_1103&r=SECTION&ty=HTML). 
* The account calling this API is a BAA under HIPAA **without** a signed BAA data processing addendum.

join_time.description: The time when participant joined the webinar.

leave_reason.description:
The reason why the participant left the webinar, where `$name` is the participant's username: 
* `$name left the meeting.` 
* `$name got disconnected from the meeting.` 
* `Host ended the meeting.` 
* `Host closed the meeting.` 
* `Host started a new meeting.` 
* `Network connection error.` 
* `Host did not join.` 
* `Exceeded free meeting minutes limit.` 
* `Removed by host.` 
* `Unknown reason.` 
* `Leave waiting room.` 
* `Removed by host from waiting room.`
enum: Removed by host from waiting room.

leave_time.description: The time when a participant left the webinar. For live webinars, this field will only return if a participant has left the ongoing webinar.

mac_addr.description:
The participant's MAC address. 

**Note:** This response returns an empty string (`““`) value for any users who are **not** a part of the host's account (external users).

microphone.description:
The type of microphone that the participant used during the webinar. 

**Note:** This response returns an empty string (`““`) value for any users who are **not** a part of the host's account (external users).

network_type.description:
The participant's network type. 

* `Wired` 
* `Wifi` 
* `PPP` - Point-to-Point. 
* `Cellular` - 3G, 4G, and 5G cellular. 
* `Others` - An unknown device.

participant_user_id.description:
The participant's universally unique ID (UUID). 
* If the participant joins the meeting by logging into Zoom, this value is the `id` value in the [**Get a user**](/docs/api-reference/zoom-api/methods#operation/user) API response. 
* If the participant joins the meeting **without** logging into Zoom, this returns an empty string value.

recording.description: Whether the recording feature was used during the webinar.

registrant_id.description:
The participant's unique registrant ID. This field only returns if you pass the `registrant_id` value for the `include_fields` query parameter. 

This field does not return if the `type` query parameter is the `live` value.

role.description:
The participant's role. 
* `host` - Host. 
* `attendee` - Attendee. 
* `panelist` - Panelist.

screen_share_quality.description:
The participant's [screen share quality score](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360061244651-Using-meeting-quality-scores-and-network-alerts). 
* `good` - The video is almost flawless and the quality is excellent. 
* `fair` - The video definition is high, occasionally gets stuck, fast or slow, or other problems, but the frequency is very low and the video quality is good. 
* `poor` - The video definition is not high, but not many problems exist. The video quality is mediocre. 
* `bad` - The picture is very blurred and often gets stuck.

share_application.description: Whether the participant chose to share an iPhone/iPad app during the screenshare.

share_desktop.description: Whether the participant chose to share their desktop during the screenshare.

share_whiteboard.description: Whether the participant chose to share their whiteboard during the screenshare.

sip_uri.description: The meeting participant's SIP (Session Initiation Protocol) Contact header URI. The API only returns this response when the participant joins a meeting via SIP.

speaker.description:
The type of speaker that the participant used during the webinar. 

**Note:** This response returns an empty string (`““`) value for any users who are **not** a part of the host's account (external users).

user_id.description: The participant's ID. This value assigned to a participant upon joining a webinar and is only valid for the webinar's duration.

participant_uuid.description: The participant's UUID. This value assigned to a participant upon joining a webinar and is only valid for the webinar's duration.

video_quality.description:
The participant's video quality. 
* `good` - The video is almost flawless and the quality is excellent. 
* `fair` - The video definition is high, occasionally gets stuck, fast or slow, or other problems, but the frequency is very low and the video quality is good. 
* `poor` - The video definition is not high, but not many problems exist. The video quality is mediocre. 
* `bad` - The picture is very blurred and often gets stuck.

audio_call.description: Information about the meeting participant's audio call. Some participants may join the meeting through the phone call or are bound to the audio.

client.description: Client software version or SDK version

has_archiving.description: The status of the archiving feature for the meeting

optional_archiving.description: This is shown only for internal participants who have archiving enabled

bo_mtg_id.description: The [breakout room](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/206476313-Managing-breakout-rooms) ID. Each breakout room is assigned a unique ID.

400.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request **Error Code:** `12702`
Cannot access a webinar a year ago.

404.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `404`
Not Found **Error Code:** `3001`
This webinar's detail information is not available or the ID is not valid.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

get.description:
Show a list of webinar participants from live or past webinars and the quality of service they received during the webinar. The data returned indicates the connection quality for sending/receiving video, audio, and shared content. 

**Note:** 

This API may return empty values for participants' `user_name`, `ip_address`, `location`, and `email` responses when the account calling this API: 
* Does **not** have a signed HIPAA business associate agreement (BAA). 
* Is a [**legacy** HIPAA BAA account](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/other-references/legacy-business-associate-agreements/). 
* Displays data for any users who are **not** part of the host's account, such as external users, unless they meet certain conditions. See [Email address display rules](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/using-zoom-apis/#email-address-display-rules) for details. 

**Prerequisites:** 
* A Business, Education, or API Plan with Webinar add-on.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `dashboard_webinars:read:admin`,`dashboard:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `dashboard:read:list_webinar_participants_qos:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `HEAVY`

parameters.name: webinarId
parameters.description:
The webinar's ID or universally unique ID (UUID). 
* If you provide a webinar ID, the API will return a response for the latest webinar instance. 
* If you provide a webinar UUID that begins with a `/` character or contains the `//` characters, you **must** double-encode the webinar UUID before making an API request.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
The type of webinar to query. 
* `past` - All past webinars. 
* `live` - All live webinars. 

This value defaults to `live`.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of items returned per page.

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: Use the next page token to paginate through large result sets. A next page token is returned whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. This token's expiration period is 15 minutes.

200.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `200`  
 
Webinar participants returned.  
 
This API is only available for ZMP and Business or higher accounts that have enabled the Dashboard feature.

device.description:

* `Phone` - The participant joined via PSTN. 
* `H.323/SIP` - The participant joined via an H.323 or SIP device. 
* `Windows` - The participant joined via VoIP using a Windows device.

* `Android` - The participant joined via VoIP using an Android device.

get.description:
When a Webinar ends, each attendee will be prompted to share their Webinar experience by clicking either thumbs up or thumbs down. Use this API to retrieve the feedback submitted for a specific webinar. Note that this API only works for meetings scheduled after December 20, 2020.

**Prerequisites:**
* [Feedback to Zoom](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115005838023) setting must be enabled by the participant prior to the meeting.
* The user making the API request must be enrolled in a Business or a higher plan.


  
  

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `dashboard_webinars:read:admin`,`dashboard:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `dashboard:read:post_webinar_feedback:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `Heavy`

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
Specify a value to get the response for the corresponding meeting type. The value of this field can be one of the following:  
    
 `past` - Meeting that already occurred in the specified date range.  
 `pastOne` - Past meetings that were attended by only one user.   
 `live` - Live meetings.  
   
 

If you do not provide this field, the default value will be `live` and thus, the API will only query responses for live meetings.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of records returned within a single API call.

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: Use the next page token to paginate through large result sets. A next page token is returned whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. This token's expiration period is 15 minutes.

parameters.name: webinarId
parameters.description:
The webinar's ID or universally unique ID (UUID). 
* If you provide a webinar ID, the API will return a response for the latest webinar instance. 
* If you provide a webinar UUID that begins with a `/` character or contains the `//` characters, you **must** [double encode](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/using-zoom-apis/#meeting-id-and-uuid) the webinar UUID before making an API request.

200.description: **HTTP Status Code:** `200`

next_page_token.description: The next page token is used to paginate through large result sets. A next page token will be returned whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. The expiration period for this token is 15 minutes.

page_size.description: The number of records returned within a single API call.

date_time.description: Date and time at which the feedback was submitted.

email.description: Email address of the participant. If the participant is **not** part of the host's account, this returns an empty string value, with some exceptions. See [Email address display rules](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/using-zoom-apis#email-address) for details.

quality.description:

get.description:
Retrieve the sharing and recording details of participants from live or past webinars.   
   
 
**Prerequisites:**  
 
* Business, Education or API Plan with Webinar add-on.



**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `dashboard_webinars:read:admin`,`dashboard:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `dashboard:read:webinar_sharing:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `Heavy`

parameters.name: webinarId
parameters.description:
The webinar's ID or universally unique ID (UUID). 
* If you provide a webinar ID, the API will return a response for the latest webinar instance. 
* If you provide a webinar UUID that begins with a `/` character or contains the `//` characters, you **must** [double encode](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/using-zoom-apis/#meeting-id-and-uuid) the webinar UUID before making an API request.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
The type of webinar to query: 
* `past` — All past webinars. 
* `live` - All live webinars. 

This value defaults to `live`.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of records returned within a single API call.

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: Use the next page token to paginate through large result sets. A next page token is returned whenever the set of available results exceed the current page size. This token's expiration period is 15 minutes.

200.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `200`  
 
Webinar participants returned.  
 
Only available for paid accounts that have enabled the Dashboard feature.

next_page_token.description: The next page token is used to paginate through large result sets. A next page token will be returned whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. The expiration period for this token is 15 minutes.

user_id.description: Participant ID. This is a unique ID assigned to the participant joining a meeting and is valid for that meeting only.

get.description:
Returns the quality of service (QoS) for participants during live or past webinars. This data returned indicates the connection quality for sending/receiving video, audio, and shared content. The API returns this data for either the API request or when the API request was last received. 

When the sender sends its data, a timestamp is attached to the sender's data packet. The receiver then returns this timestamp to the sender. This helps determine the upstream and downstream latency, which includes the application processing time. The latency data returned is the five second average and five second maximum. 

This API will **not** return data if there is no data being sent or received at the time of request. 

**Note:** 

This API may return empty values for participants' `user_name`, `ip_address`, `location`, and `email` responses when the account calling this API: 
* Does **not** have a signed HIPAA business associate agreement (BAA). 
* Is a [**legacy** HIPAA BAA account](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/other-references/legacy-business-associate-agreements/). 
* Displays data for any users who are **not** part of the host's account, such as external users, unless they meet certain conditions. See [Email address display rules](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/using-zoom-apis/#email-address-display-rules) for details. 

**Prerequisites:** 
* A Business, Education, or API Plan with Zoom Rooms set up.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `dashboard_webinars:read:admin`,`dashboard:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `dashboard:read:webinar_participant_qos:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `HEAVY`

parameters.name: webinarId
parameters.description:
The webinar's ID or universally unique ID (UUID). 
* If you provide a webinar ID, the API will return a response for the latest webinar instance. 
* If you provide a webinar UUID that begins with a `/` character or contains the `//` characters, you **must** double-encode the webinar UUID before making an API request.

parameters.name: participantId
parameters.description: The participant's ID.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
The type of webinar to query. 
* `past` - All past webinars. 
* `live` - All live webinars. 

This value defaults to `live`.

200.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `200`  
 
Webinar participant QOS returned.  
 
This API is only available for ZMP and Business or higher accounts that have enabled the Dashboard feature.

schema.title: The participant QOS.

id.description: The participant's universally unique ID. This value is the same as the participant's user ID if the participant joins the webinar by logging into Zoom. If the participant joins the webinar without logging into Zoom, this returns an empty value.

device.description:
The type of device the participant used to join the meeting. 
* `Phone` - The participant joined via PSTN. 
* `H.323/SIP` - The participant joined with an H.323 or SIP device. 
* `Windows` - The participant joined with VoIP using a Windows device. 
* `Mac` - The participant joined through VoIP using a Mac device. 
* `iOS` - The participant joined through VoIP using an iOS device. 
* `Android` - The participant joined through VoIP using an Android device. 

**Note:** This response returns an empty string value for any users who are **not** a part of the host's account, such as external users.

domain.description:
The participant's PC domain. 

**Note:** This response returns an empty string value for any users who are **not** a part of the host's account, such as external user).

harddisk_id.description:
The participant's hard disk ID. 

**Note:** This response returns an empty string value for any users who are **not** a part of the host's account, such as external users.

internal_ip_addresses.description:
The participant's internal IP addresses. This field will not return under these conditions: 
* The account calling this API is a **legacy** [business associate agreement (BAA) under HIPAA](https://www.ecfr.gov/cgi-bin/retrieveECFR?gp=1&n=se45.1.160_1103&r=SECTION&ty=HTML). 
* The account calling this API is a BAA under HIPAA **without** a signed BAA data processing addendum.

join_time.description: The time when the participant joined the meeting.

leave_time.description: The time when the participant left the meeting.

mac_addr.description:
The participant's MAC address. 

**Note:** This response returns an empty string value for any users who are **not** a part of the host's account, such as external users.

user_id.description: The participant's ID. This value is assigned to a participant when they joining a meeting, and is only valid for the meeting's duration.

user_qos.description: The participant's quality of service information.

avg_loss.description: The average amount of packet loss, such as the percentage of packets that failed to arrive at their destination.

bitrate.description: The bits per second transmitted along a digital network, in kbps.

jitter.description: The variation in the delay of received packets, in milliseconds.

latency.description: The time it took a packet to travel from one point to another, in milliseconds.

max_loss.description: The maximum amount of packet loss, such as the maximum percentage of packets that failed to arrive at their destination.

frame_rate.description: The rate where the video camera can produce unique images (frames). Zoom supports a frame rate of up to 30 fps.

resolution.description: The number of pixels in each dimension that the video camera can display.

data_center.description: The data center that the participant is leveraging to join the webinar.

full_data_center.description: The data center where participant's meeting data is stored. This field includes a semicolon-separated list of HTTP Tunnel (HT), Cloud Room Connector (CRC), and Real-Time Web Gateway (RWG) location information.

share_application.description: Whether the participant chose to share an application during the meeting.

share_desktop.description: Whether the participant chose to share their desktop during the screenshare.

share_whiteboard.description: Whether the participant chose to share their whiteboard during the screenshare.

recording.description: Whether the recording feature was used during the webinar.

has_archiving.description: The status of the archiving feature for the meeting

optional_archiving.description: This is shown only for internal participants who have archiving enabled

webinar_number.description: Unique identifier of the webinar in "long" format(represented as int64 data type in JSON)

email.description: The participant's email address. If the participant is **not** part of the host's account, this returns an empty string value, with some exceptions. See [Email address display rules](/docs/api-reference/using-zoom-apis#email-address) for details.

Zoom Room Issue details returned

issue_name.description:
Issue Name.  
  The value of the this field could be one of the following:  
 
* `Room Controller disconnected`  
 
* `Room Controller connected`
* `Selected camera has disconnected`
* `Selected camera is reconnected`
* `Selected microphone has disconnected`
* `Selected microphone is reconnected`
* `Selected speaker has disconnected`
* `Selected speaker is reconnected`
* `Zoom room is offline`
* `Zoom room is online`
* `High CPU usage is detected`
* `Low bandwidth network is detected`
* `{name} battery is low`
* `{name} battery is normal`
* `{name} disconnected`
* `{name} connected`
* `{name} is not charging`

Possible values for {name}:   
 
* Zoom Rooms Computer 
* Controller
* Scheduling Display

get.description:
Returns download link for given `fileId`. 

The download link expires after 5 minutes, and can only be used once.

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `data_request:read:download:admin`

download_url.description: Download link that can be used to directly download file from Zoom's fileserver. It has a 5-minute expiration time, and can only be consumed once.

post.description:
Submit a request to:
* Export data for a specified time period.
* **Delete all data** associated with a user's email.

**Note**: You can revoke deletion requests up to 30 minutes after submission.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `data_request:write:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `data_request:write:request:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `MEDIUM`

requestBody.description:
Provide a JSON object with the following properties:

- `emails` *(array of strings, required)*  A list of user email addresses whose data will be included in the request.

- `requestType` *(string, required)*  The type of request to perform. Must be either "EXPORT" or "DELETION".

- `startDate` *(string, optional)*  The start of the time window for data export, in ISO 8601 format. Required only if requestType is "EXPORT". Must be earlier than endDate.

- `endDate` *(string, optional)*  The end of the time window for data export, in ISO 8601 format. Required only if requestType is "EXPORT".

emails.description: Array of valid emails belonging to requested account

start_date.description: The start time of the export window, expressed as an ISO 8601formatted date string (e.g., 2025-09-02T15:04:05Z). This field is required for export requests and must be strictly earlier than endDate.

end_date.description: The end time of the export window, expressed as an ISO 8601formatted date string (e.g., 2025-09-02T15:04:05Z). This field is required for export requests and must be strictly later than startDate.

request_type.description: The request type. It must be either EXPORT or DELETION.

emails.description: Array of valid emails belonging to requested account

request_type.description: The request type. It must be either EXPORT or DELETION.

201.description: **HTTP Status Code:** `200`     The request was created successfully. For export requests, the system begins preparing the data for the specified time period. For deletion requests, the system schedules deletion of the specified users data (with a 30-minute revocation window).

data.description: An array containing JSON objects for each data request created

email.description: Email of data request

items.description: JSON object for an individual data request

You can only input up to 10 emails in one request.
