get.description:
Return a list of all [Information Barriers](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360040913711-Information-Barriers) policies and their information. 

 **Prerequisites:** 
* [Contact Zoom Support](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362003) to enable Information Barriers for your account.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `information_barriers:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `information_barrier:read:list_policies:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `MEDIUM`

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of records to return per API call

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: Token from previous API call that indicates to get the next page of results

200.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `200`   
  InformationBarriers returned.

policies.description: A list of group policy JSONs containing "assigned_group_id", "id", "policy_name", "settings", "status", "to_group_id", "type"

complete_phone_calls.description: If true, users between groups **cannot** call each other.

file_transfer.description: If true, users between groups **cannot** transfer files in a meeting. This also creates a [soft block](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360040913711-Information-Barriers#h_a603c6f7-05c8-4de5-b4b6-91982d748b34) between both groups if the `meeting` value is `false`.

im.description: If true, users between groups **cannot** IM chat. This also creates a [soft block](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360040913711-Information-Barriers#h_a603c6f7-05c8-4de5-b4b6-91982d748b34) between both groups if the `meeting` value is `false`.

in_meeting_chat.description: If true, users between groups **cannot** use chat in a meeting. This also creates a [soft block](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360040913711-Information-Barriers#h_a603c6f7-05c8-4de5-b4b6-91982d748b34) between both groups if the `meeting` value is `false`.

meeting.description: If true, the users between groups **cannot** meet. This also creates a [hard block](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360040913711-Information-Barriers#h_a603c6f7-05c8-4de5-b4b6-91982d748b34) between both groups.

message_via_sms.description: If true, users between groups **cannot** user SMS.

recording.description:
If true, users between groups **cannot** record the meeting. This also creates a [soft block](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360040913711-Information-Barriers#h_a603c6f7-05c8-4de5-b4b6-91982d748b34) between both groups if the `meeting` value is `false`. 

This feature is only available for Zoom Client v5.6.0 and higher.

screen_share.description: If true, users between groups **cannot** share screens in a meeting. This also creates a [soft block](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360040913711-Information-Barriers#h_a603c6f7-05c8-4de5-b4b6-91982d748b34) between both groups if the `meeting` value is `false`.

settings.description:
The Information Barriers policy's settings. 
* If the `meeting` setting is `true`, then a [hard block](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360040913711-Information-Barriers#h_a603c6f7-05c8-4de5-b4b6-91982d748b34) exists between both groups. 
* If the `meeting` setting is `false` but the `screen_share`, `file_transfer`, `in_meeting_chat`, `im`, and/or `recording` settings are `true`, then a [soft block](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360040913711-Information-Barriers#h_a603c6f7-05c8-4de5-b4b6-91982d748b34) exists between both groups.

status.description:
The Information Barriers policy's status. 
* `0` — Disabled. 
* `1` — Enabled.

type.description:
The Information Barriers policy's type of `settings` restrictions. 
* `0` — A [hard or soft block](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360040913711-Information-Barriers#h_a603c6f7-05c8-4de5-b4b6-91982d748b34) exists, but users in Group 1 and Group 2 can chat with each other. 
* `1` — A [hard or soft block](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360040913711-Information-Barriers#h_a603c6f7-05c8-4de5-b4b6-91982d748b34) exists and only users in Group 1 can chat with users in Group 2. 
* `2` — No blocks exist, but only users in Group 1 can chat with users in Group 2. 
* `3` — No blocks exist and users in Group 1 and Group 2 can chat with each other. 

This field only supports `0`.

total_records.description: The total count of Information Barriers policies.

next_page_token.description: Token that can be passed in a subsequent API call to retrieve next page of results.

400.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request **Error Code:** `200`
Not available for this account, {0}
**Error Code:** `200`
Only available for Paid account: {0}.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

post.description:
Create a new Information Barrier policy. [Information Barriers](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360040913711-Information-Barriers) help customers control communication policies and meet regulatory requirements at scale. Use information barriers to prevent specific groups of users who possess sensitive information from communicating with others who should not know this information. 

 **Prerequisites:** 
* [Contact Zoom Support](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362003) to enable Information Barriers for your account.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `information_barriers:write:admin`

* If the `meeting` setting is `false` but the `screen_share`, `file_transfer`, `in_meeting_chat`, `im`, and/or `recording` settings are `true`, then a [soft block](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360040913711-Information-Barriers#h_a603c6f7-05c8-4de5-b4b6-91982d748b34) exists between both groups.

status.description:
The Information Barriers policy's status. 
* `0` — Disabled. 
* `1` — Enabled.

type.description:
The Information Barriers policy's type of `settings` restrictions. 
* `0` — A [hard or soft block](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360040913711-Information-Barriers#h_a603c6f7-05c8-4de5-b4b6-91982d748b34) exists, but users in Group 1 and Group 2 can chat with each other. 
* `1` — A [hard or soft block](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360040913711-Information-Barriers#h_a603c6f7-05c8-4de5-b4b6-91982d748b34) exists and only users in Group 1 can chat with users in Group 2. 
* `2` — No blocks exist, but only users in Group 1 can chat with users in Group 2. 
* `3` — No blocks exist and users in Group 1 and Group 2 can chat with each other. 

This field only supports `0`.

List [roles](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115001078646-Role-Based-Access-Control) on your account

**Prerequisites** :
*  Pro or higher plan. 
*  For setting the initial role, you must be the Account Owner. 
*  For subsequent role management, you must be the Account Owner or user with role management permissions.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `role:read:admin`,`role:write:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `role:read:list_roles`,`role:read:list_roles:admin`

post.description:
Each Zoom user automatically has a role which can either be owner, administrator, or member. 

**Pre-requisites**  
 
* Pro or higher plan.
* To set the initial role, you must be the account owner.  
 
* For subsequent role management, you must be either the account owner or user with role management permissions.  
 


**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `role:write:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `role:write:role`,`role:write:role:admin`

get.description:
Each Zoom user automatically has a role which can either be owner, administrator, or member. Account owners and users with edit privileges for role management can add customized roles with a list of privileges.

Use this API to get information including specific privileges assigned to a [role](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115001078646-Role-Based-Access-Control).  
 
**Pre-requisites**  
 
* A Pro or higher plan.  
 
* For role management and updates, you must be either the account owner or a user with role management permissions.



**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `role:read:admin`,`role:write:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `role:read:role`,`role:read:role:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

parameters.description: The role ID.

Information about a specific role returned.

**Error Code:** `200`  
 
You do not have the permission to retrieve role information.

type.description: The role's type.

privileges.description: Privileges assigned to the role. Can be one or more of [these permissions](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/other-references/privileges/).

second_level.description:
Indicates how the account can manage sub-accounts. 
 
`1` - Manage the sub-account as an owner of the account.  
 
`2` - Manage the sub-account with the same privileges as the current account.  
 
`3` - Manage the sub-account with specified privileges.

sub_account_privileges.description: This field will only be displayed to accounts enrolled in a partner plan and following the master accounts and sub-accounts structure.

total_members.description: Total members assigned to that role.

privilege_scopes.description: Role scope info, which include permission id, group id list. This field will only return permission which checked specific scope.

permission_id.description: Privileges assigned to the role. Can be one or more of [these permissions](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/other-references/privileges/).

group_ids.description: User group id list that you checked for specific permission(s) on the role setting page.

Provided `role_id` does not exist.

Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

get.description:
Queries all surveys in the current account.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `survey:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `survey_management:read:list_surveys:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `MEDIUM`

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of records returned within a single API call.

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: Use the next page token to paginate through a large set of results. A next page token returns whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. This token's expiration period is 15 minutes.

200.description: **HTTP Status Code:** `200`   The surveys of current account returned.

surveys.description: The survey list of the current account.

survey_type.description:
The type of survey.
- `basic_poll` -- Basic Poll (requires the `Survey:Read` permission).
- `advanced_poll` -- Advanced Poll (requires the `Survey:Read` permission).
- `quiz` -- Quiz (requires the `Survey:Read` permission).
- `survey` -- Survey (requires the `Survey:Read` permission).
- `consumer_engagement_survey` -- Consumer Engagement Survey (requires the `EngagementSurvey:Read` permission).

next_page_token.description: Use the next page token to paginates through a large set of results. A next page token returns whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. This token's expiration period is 15 minutes.

400.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request **Error Code:** `300`
The next page token is invalid or expired.
**Error Code:** `200`
No permission.

403.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `403`
Forbidden **Error Code:** `6720`
You don't have the permissions to access survey.

404.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `404`
Not Found

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

get.description:
Queries the latest version of survey information from `surveyId`.


**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `survey:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `survey_management:read:survey:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `LIGHT`

parameters.name: surveyId
parameters.description: The UUID of survey.

200.description: **HTTP Status Code:** `200`  Survey info returned.

survey_type.description:
The type of survey.
- `basic_poll` -- Basic Poll (requires the `Survey:Read` permission).
- `advanced_poll` -- Advanced Poll (requires the `Survey:Read` permission).
- `quiz` -- Quiz (requires the `Survey:Read` permission).
- `survey` -- Survey (requires the `Survey:Read` permission).
- `consumer_engagement_survey` -- Consumer Engagement Survey (requires the `EngagementSurvey:Read` permission).

published.description: The survey is published or closed.

anonymous.description: The survey is anonymous or non-anonymous.

question_type.description:
The type of question.
- `single` -- Single choice.
- `multiple` -- Multiple choice.
- `matching` -- Matching.
- `rank_order` -- Rank order.
- `short_answer` -- Short answer.
- `long_answer` -- Long answer.
- `fill_in_the_blank` -- Fill in the blank.
- `rating_scale` -- Rating scale.

required.description: The required question to answer or not.

sub_questions.description: Only **Matching/Rank order** question has sub questions.

sub_question_name.description: The sub question in a question.

options.description:
The options of a question.
For example, there are four options in a **Single choice** question, and option is used to represent each of the options.

option_label.description: Only **Rating scale** question has this field to describe the score.

400.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request **Error Code:** `200`
No permission.

403.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `403`
Forbidden **Error Code:** `6720`
You don't have the permissions to access survey.

404.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `404`
Not Found **Error Code:** `6701`
Invalid parameter survey id.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

get.description:
Queries the answers of survey from `surveyId`.

You can use the same survey cmultiple times in different products(Meeting/Webinar/Team Chat/Contact Center). 

We call it an instance each time we use it.

This API returns the historical answers of each survey instance.

**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `survey:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `survey_management:read:list_survey_answers:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `MEDIUM`

parameters.name: surveyId
parameters.description: The UUID of survey.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of records returned within a single API call.

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: The next page token paginates through a large set of results. It returns whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. The expiration period for this token is 15 minutes.

parameters.name: instance_id
parameters.description:
**Optional** Returns the answers of the survey in the specified instance.
This parameter needs double encode.

parameters.name: submit_time_start
parameters.description: Start of submit time range (ISO 8601 format, e.g., 2025-09-22T10:00:00Z).

parameters.name: submit_time_end
parameters.description: End of submit time range (ISO 8601 format, e.g., 2025-09-22T10:00:00Z).

200.description: **HTTP Status Code:** `200`   Survey answers returned.

survey_answers.description: The user's answers of the survey, include user infos and answers.

email.description: Participant's email. If the survey is anonymous, the `email` field will contain an `Empty` string.

name.description: Participant's display name. If the survey is anonymous, the value of the `name` field will be `Empty` string.

instance_id.description: The UUID of an instance.For meeting surveys, this field is also meeting_uuid.

submit_time.description: The answer submission time in UTC.

anonymous.description: Whether the answer is anonymous or not.

questions.description: The user's answers of the survey.

question_answers.description:
The answer of a question.
It is represented by an array. 
For exaples:
  - If it is a multiple choice question, the option id is the selected option. 
  - If there are three blanks in a fill-in-the-blank question and the user fills in the first and third blanks, then there are two values in the array, and the option_id represents which space it is, and the answer is the user's input.

sub_questions.description:
The answer of the sub question.
Only **Matching/Rank order** question has sub questions.

sub_question_answers.description:
The answer of a sub question.
It is represented by an array. 
For exaple:
  - If it is a Matching question, the option id is the selected option of a sub question.

option_id.description: The UUID of option of a sub question.

next_page_token.description: The next page token paginates through a large set of results. It returns whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. The expiration period for this token is 15 minutes.

400.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request **Error Code:** `6703`
Invalid parameter survey instance id.
**Error Code:** `300`
The next page token is invalid or expired.

403.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `403`
Forbidden **Error Code:** `6720`
You don't have the permissions to access survey.

404.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `404`
Not Found **Error Code:** `6701`
Invalid parameter survey id.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).

get.description:
Query the instances which used the survey, based on `surveyId`.
The same survey can be used multiple times in different products(meeting/webinar/team chat/contact center). Each time it is used, we call it an instance. 
This API is used to return the historical information of each survey instance.



**[Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `survey:read:admin`

**[Granular Scopes](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/integrations/oauth-scopes-overview/):** `survey_management:read:list_survey_instances:admin`

**[Rate Limit Label](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/api-reference/rate-limits#rate-limits):** `MEDIUM`

parameters.name: surveyId
parameters.description: The UUID of survey.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of records returned within a single API call.

parameters.name: next_page_token
parameters.description: Use the next page token to paginate through large result sets. A next page token is returned whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. This token's expiration period is 15 minutes.

parameters.name: instance_id
parameters.description:
**Optional**, return the survey information used in the specified instance.
This parameter needs dobule encode.

200.description: **HTTP Status Code:** `200`   Survey instances returned.

instance_id.description: The UUID of an instance.For meeting surveys, this field is also meeting_uuid.

product_type.description:
The product used this survey.
- `meeting` -- Meeting (requires `Survey:Read` permission).
- `webinar` -- Webinar (requires `Survey:Read` permission).
- `survey_public_link` -- Survey Public Link (requires `Survey:Read` permission).
- `team_chat` -- Team Chat (requires `Survey:Read` permission).
- `contact_center` -- Zoom Contact Center (requires `EngagementSurvey:Read` permission).
- `vitual_agent` -- Zoom Vitual Agent (requires `EngagementSurvey:Read` permission).

has_response.description: Attendee has a response or not.

survey_type.description:
The type of survey.
- `basic_poll` -- Basic Poll (requires the `Survey:Read` permission).
- `advanced_poll` -- Advanced Poll (requires the `Survey:Read` permission).
- `quiz` -- Quiz (requires the `Survey:Read` permission).
- `survey` -- Survey (requires the `Survey:Read` permission).
- `consumer_engagement_survey` -- Consumer Engagement Survey (requires the `EngagementSurvey:Read` permission).

anonymous.description: The survey instance is anonymous or non-anonymous.

question_type.description:
The type of question.
- `single` -- Single choice.
- `multiple` -- Multiple choice.
- `matching` -- Matching.
- `rank_order` -- Rank order.
- `short_answer` -- Short answer.
- `long_answer` -- Long answer.
- `fill_in_the_blank` -- Fill in the blank.
- `rating_scale` -- Rating scale.

required.description: The question is required to answer or not.

sub_questions.description: Only **Matching/Rank order** question has sub questions.

sub_question_name.description: The sub question in a question.

options.description: The options of a question. For example, there are four options in a **Single choice** question, and option is used to represent each of the options.

option_label.description: Only **Rating scale** question has this field to describe the score.

meeting_id.description: Meeting ID: Unique identifier of the meeting in "long" format(represented as string data type in JSON), also known as the meeting number.This field is only returned for meeting surveys.

next_page_token.description: Use the next page token to paginate through large result sets. A next page token is returned whenever the set of available results exceeds the current page size. This token's expiration period is 15 minutes.

400.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `400`
Bad Request **Error Code:** `6703`
Invalid parameter survey instance id.
**Error Code:** `300`
The next page token is invalid or expired.

403.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `403`
Forbidden **Error Code:** `6720`
You don't have the permissions to access survey.

404.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `404`
Not Found **Error Code:** `6701`
Invalid parameter survey id.

429.description:
**HTTP Status Code:** `429`
Too Many Requests. For more information, see [rate limits](https://developers.zoom.us/docs/api/rest/rate-limits/).
